Search Wikipedia for a query.
Uses it to get detailed information about a public figure, interpretation of a complex scientific concept or in-depth connectivity of a significant historical event,.

Get an answer to a question using Wolfram Alpha. Input should the query in English.
Use it to answer user questions that require computation, detailed facts, data analysis, or complex queries.

description:
Manages the current playback with the following actions:
    - get: Get information about user's current track.
    - start: Starts playing new item or resumes current playback if called with no uri.
    - pause: Pauses current playback.
    - skip: Skips current track.
name: spotify_spotifyplayback

parameters.description:
Manages the current playback with the following actions:
- get: Get information about user's current track.
- start: Starts playing new item or resumes current playback if called with no uri.
- pause: Pauses current playback.
- skip: Skips current track.

num_skips.description: Number of tracks to skip for `skip` action.
num_skips.title: Num Skips

spotify_uri.description: Spotify uri of item to play for 'start' action. If omitted, resumes current playback.
spotify_uri.title: Spotify Uri

parameters.title: Playback

description: Search for tracks, albums, artists, or playlists on Spotify.
name: spotify_spotifysearch

parameters.description: Search for tracks, albums, artists, or playlists on Spotify.

limit.description: Maximum number of items to return
limit.title: Limit

qtype.description: Type of items to search for (track, album, artist, playlist, or comma-separated combination)
qtype.title: Qtype

parameters.title: Search

description: Manage the playback queue - get the queue or add tracks.
name: spotify_spotifyqueue

parameters.description: Manage the playback queue - get the queue or add tracks.

track_id.description: Track ID to add to queue (required for add action)
track_id.title: Track Id

parameters.title: Queue

description: Get detailed information about a Spotify item (track, album, artist, or playlist).
name: spotify_spotifygetinfo

parameters.description: Get detailed information about a Spotify item (track, album, artist, or playlist).

item_id.description: ID of the item to get information about
item_id.title: Item Id

qtype.description: Type of item: 'track', 'album', 'artist', or 'playlist'. If 'playlist' or 'album', returns its tracks. If 'artist',returns albums and top tracks.
qtype.title: Qtype

parameters.title: GetInfo

description:
Query Gmail emails based on an optional search query. 
            Returns emails in reverse chronological order (newest first).
            Returns metadata such as subject and also a short summary of the content.
name: mcp_gsuite_query_gmail_emails

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

max_results.description: Maximum number of emails to retrieve (1-500)

query.description:
Gmail search query (optional). Examples:
                            - a $string: Search email body, subject, and sender information for $string
                            - 'is:unread' for unread emails
                            - 'from:example@gmail.com' for emails from a specific sender
                            - 'newer_than:2d' for emails from last 2 days
                            - 'has:attachment' for emails with attachments
                            If not provided, returns recent emails without filtering.

description: Retrieves a complete Gmail email message by its ID, including the full message body and attachment IDs.
name: mcp_gsuite_get_gmail_email

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

email_id.description: The ID of the Gmail message to retrieve

description:
Creates a draft email message from scratch in Gmail with specified recipient, subject, body, and optional CC recipients.
            
            Do NOT use this tool when you want to draft or send a REPLY to an existing message. This tool does NOT include any previous message content. Use the reply_gmail_email tool
            with send=False instead."
name: mcp_gsuite_create_gmail_draft

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

cc.description: Optional list of email addresses to CC

description: Deletes a Gmail draft message by its ID. This action cannot be undone.
name: mcp_gsuite_delete_gmail_draft

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

draft_id.description: The ID of the draft to delete

description:
Creates a reply to an existing Gmail email message and either sends it or saves as draft.

            Use this tool if you want to draft a reply. Use the 'cc' argument if you want to perform a "reply all".
name: mcp_gsuite_reply_gmail_email

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

cc.description: Optional list of email addresses to CC on the reply

original_message_id.description: The ID of the Gmail message to reply to

reply_body.description: The body content of your reply message

send.description: If true, sends the reply immediately. If false, saves as draft.

description: Retrieves a Gmail attachment by its ID.
name: mcp_gsuite_get_gmail_attachment

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

attachment_id.description: The ID of the attachment to retrieve

message_id.description: The ID of the Gmail message containing the attachment

mime_type.description: The MIME type of the attachment

save_to_disk.description: The fullpath to save the attachment to disk. If not provided, the attachment is returned as a resource.

description: Retrieves multiple Gmail email messages by their IDs in a single request, including the full message bodies and attachment IDs.
name: mcp_gsuite_bulk_get_gmail_emails

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

email_ids.description: List of Gmail message IDs to retrieve

description: Saves multiple Gmail attachments to disk by their message IDs and attachment IDs in a single request.
name: mcp_gsuite_bulk_save_gmail_attachments

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

message_id.description: ID of the Gmail message containing the attachment

part_id.description: ID of the part containing the attachment

save_path.description: Path where the attachment should be saved

description:
Lists all calendars accessible by the user. 
            Call it before any other tool whenever the user specifies a particular agenda (Family, Holidays, etc.).
name: mcp_gsuite_list_calendars

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

description: Retrieves calendar events from the user's Google Calendar within a specified time range.
name: mcp_gsuite_get_calendar_events

__calendar_id__.description:
Optional ID of the specific agenda for which you are executing this action.
                          If not provided, the default calendar is being used. 
                          If not known, the specific calendar id can be retrieved with the list_calendars tool

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

max_results.description: Maximum number of events to return (1-2500)

time_max.description: End time in RFC3339 format (e.g. 2024-12-31T23:59:59Z). Optional.

time_min.description: Start time in RFC3339 format (e.g. 2024-12-01T00:00:00Z). Defaults to current time if not specified.

description: Creates a new event in a specified Google Calendar of the specified user.
name: mcp_gsuite_create_calendar_event

__calendar_id__.description:
Optional ID of the specific agenda for which you are executing this action.
                          If not provided, the default calendar is being used. 
                          If not known, the specific calendar id can be retrieved with the list_calendars tool

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

description.description: Description or notes for the event (optional)

send_notifications.description: Whether to send notifications to attendees

timezone.description: Timezone for the event (e.g. 'America/New_York'). Defaults to UTC if not specified.

description: Deletes an event from the user's Google Calendar by its event ID.
name: mcp_gsuite_delete_calendar_event

__calendar_id__.description:
Optional ID of the specific agenda for which you are executing this action.
                          If not provided, the default calendar is being used. 
                          If not known, the specific calendar id can be retrieved with the list_calendars tool

__user_id__.description: The EMAIL of the Google account for which you are executing this action. Can be one of: Account for email: seanbugeja23@gmail.com of type: personal. Extra info for: Contains personal calander

event_id.description: The ID of the calendar event to delete

send_notifications.description: Whether to send cancellation notifications to attendees

description:
IMPORTANT: First check if project context is already available in the conversation before making any new requests. Use lc-get-files for retrieving specific files, and only use this tool when a broad repository overview is needed.

Generates a structured repository overview including: 1) Directory tree with file status ( full,  outline,  excluded) 2) Complete contents of key files 3) Smart outlines highlighting important definitions in supported languages. The output is customizable via profiles that control file inclusion rules and presentation format. The assistant tracks previously retrieved project context in the conversation and checks this history before making new requests.
name: llmcontext_lc_project_context

profile_name.description: Profile to use (e.g. 'code', 'copy', 'full') - defines file inclusion and presentation rules
profile_name.title: Profile Name

description: IMPORTANT: Check previously retrieved file contents before making new requests. Retrieves (read-only) complete contents of specified files from the project. The assistant cannot modify files with this tool - it only reads their contents.
name: llmcontext_lc_get_files

paths.description: File paths relative to root_path, starting with a forward slash and including the root directory name. For example, if root_path is '/home/user/projects/myproject', then a valid path would be '/myproject/src/main.py
paths.title: Paths

description: IMPORTANT: First get the generation timestamp from the project context. Returns a list of paths to files that have been modified since a given timestamp. This is typically used to track which files have changed during the conversation. After getting the list, use lc-get-files to examine the contents of any modified files of interest.
name: llmcontext_lc_list_modified_files

profile_name.description: Profile to use (e.g. 'code', 'copy', 'full') - defines file inclusion and presentation rules
profile_name.title: Profile Name

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp to check modifications since
timestamp.title: Timestamp

description: Returns smart outlines highlighting important definitions in all supported code files. This provides a high-level overview of code structure without retrieving full file contents. Outlines show key definitions (classes, functions, methods) in the codebase.
name: llmcontext_lc_code_outlines

profile_name.description: Profile to use for file selection rules
profile_name.title: Profile Name
